task.title: Make Outbound Calls
task.shortdesc: Outbound routes are used to specify what numbers are allowed to go out a particular route. When a call is placed, the actual number dialed by the user is compared with the dial patterns in each route (from highest to lowest priority) until a match is found. If no match is found, the call fails. If the number dialed matches a pattern in more than one route, only the rules with the highest priority in the route are used.

context.p: The default outbound route (with dial pattern X.) on the PBX will allow any outgoing numbers. You can make outbound calls as you usually do on your phone.

step.cmd: Go to Settings PBX Call Control Outbound Routes .
Click to edit the default inbound route.
In the Member Trunks field, double click the desired trunk in the Available box, the trunk will appear in Selected box.
step.info: The users can only use the selected trunk to make outbound calls through this route.

step.cmd: In the Member Extensions field, double click the desired extensions in the Available box, the extensions will appear on Selected box.
step.info: Only the selected extension users can make outbound calls through this route.

taskbody.result: Now, the selected extension users can make outbound calls through this route.
